name: Edvard Munch
english_bio: Painter and graphic artist whose 1893 work The Scream became one of Western art's most acclaimed images, with notable works including Madonna and The Sick Child.
norwegian_bio: Maler og grafiker hvis verk fra 1893 Skriket ble et av vestlig kunsts mest anerkjente bilder, med bemerkelsesverdige verk inkludert Madonna og Det syke barn.
summary:
Edvard Munch ( MUUNK; Norwegian: [ˈɛ̀dvɑɖ ˈmʊŋk] ; 12 December 1863 – 23 January 1944) was a Norwegian painter. His 1893 work The Scream has become one of Western art's most acclaimed images.
His childhood was overshadowed by illness, bereavement and the dread of inheriting a mental condition that ran in the family. Studying at the Royal School of Art and Design in Kristiania (Oslo), Munch began to live a bohemian life under the influence of the nihilist Hans Jæger, who urged him to paint his own emotional and psychological state ('soul painting'); from this emerged his distinctive style.
Travel brought new influences and outlets. In Paris, he learned much from Paul Gauguin, Vincent van Gogh and Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, especially their use of color. In Berlin, he met the Swedish dramatist August Strindberg, whom he painted, as he embarked on a major series of paintings he would later call The Frieze of Life, depicting a series of deeply-felt themes such as love, anxiety, jealousy and betrayal, steeped in atmosphere.
The Scream was conceived in Kristiania. According to Munch, he was out walking at sunset, when he 'heard the enormous, infinite scream of nature'. The painting's agonized face is widely identified with the angst of the modern person. Between 1893 and 1910, he made two painted versions and two in pastels, as well as a number of prints. One of the pastels would eventually command the fourth highest nominal price paid for a painting at auction.

As his fame and wealth grew, his emotional state remained insecure. He briefly considered marriage, but could not commit himself. A mental breakdown in 1908 forced him to give up heavy drinking, and he was cheered by his increasing acceptance by the people of Kristiania and exposure in the city's museums. His later years were spent working in peace and privacy. Although his works were banned in Nazi-occupied Europe, most of them survived World War II, securing him a legacy.

name: Johan Christian Dahl
deathplace: Dresden, Kingdom of Saxony, German Confederation
english_bio: Danish-Norwegian artist considered the first great romantic painter in Norway and founder of the golden age of Norwegian painting.
norwegian_bio: Dansk-norsk kunstner betraktet som den første store romantiske maler i Norge og grunnlegger av den gyldne alder for norsk maleri.
summary:
Johan Christian Claussen Dahl (24 February 1788 – 14 October 1857), often known as J. C. Dahl or I. C. Dahl, was a Danish-Norwegian artist who is considered the first great romantic painter in Norway, the founder of the "golden age" of Norwegian painting. He is often described as "the father of Norwegian landscape painting" and is regarded as the first Norwegian painter to reach a level of artistic accomplishment comparable to that attained by the greatest European artists of his day. He was also the first to acquire genuine fame and cultural renown abroad. As one critic has put it, "J.C. Dahl occupies a central position in Norwegian artistic life of the first half of the 19th century.
Although Dahl spent much of his life outside of Norway, his love for his country is clear in the motifs he chose for his paintings and in his extraordinary efforts on behalf of Norwegian culture generally. He was, for example, a key figure in the founding of the Norwegian National Gallery and of several other major art institutions in Norway, as well as in the preservation of Norwegian stave churches and the restoration of the Nidaros Cathedral in Trondheim and Bergenhus Fortress in Bergen.

name: Christian Krohg
english_bio: Naturalist painter, illustrator, author and journalist focused on social scenes.
norwegian_bio: Naturalistisk maler, illustratør, forfatter og journalist fokusert på sosiale scener.
summary: Christian Krohg (13 August 1852 – 16 October 1925) was a Norwegian naturalist painter, illustrator, author and journalist. Krohg was inspired by the realism art movement and often chose motifs from everyday life. He was the director and  served as the first professor at the Norwegian Academy of Arts from 1909 to 1925.

name: Theodor Kittelsen
english_bio: Artist famous for nature paintings and illustrations of fairy tales and legends, especially trolls.
norwegian_bio: Kunstner kjent for naturmalerier og illustrasjoner av eventyr og legender, spesielt troll.
awards: Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav
summary: Theodor Severin Kittelsen (27 April 1857 – 21 January 1914) was a Norwegian artist.  He is one of the most popular artists in Norway.  Kittelsen became famous for his nature paintings, as well as for his illustrations of fairy tales and legends, especially of trolls.

name: Harriet Backer
english_bio: Pioneer female painter known for detailed interior scenes with rich colors and interplay of light and shadow.
norwegian_bio: Pioner kvinnelig maler kjent for detaljerte interiørscener med rike farger og samspill mellom lys og skygge.

name: Kitty Lange Kielland
english_bio: Landscape painter and early female Impressionist who trained under Hans Gude and made rapid progress in realism.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler og tidlig kvinnelig impresjonist som trente under Hans Gude og gjorde rask fremgang i realisme.
summary: Kitty Lange Kielland (8 October 1843 – 1 October 1914) was a Norwegian landscape painter.

name: Peter Nicolai Arbo
english_bio: Historical painter specializing in portraits and allegorical scenes from Norwegian history and Norse mythology, noted for The Wild Hunt of Odin and Valkyrie.
norwegian_bio: Historisk maler spesialisert i portretter og allegoriske scener fra norsk historie og norrøn mytologi, kjent for Odins villjakt og Valkyrie.

name: Hans Gude
birthplace: Christiania, United Kingdoms of Sweden and Norway
english_bio: Romanticist painter considered one of Norway's foremost landscape artists alongside Johan Christian Dahl.
norwegian_bio: Romantisk maler betraktet som en av Norges fremste landskapsmalere ved siden av Johan Christian Dahl.
summary:
Hans Fredrik Gude (March 13, 1825 – August 17, 1903) was a Norwegian romanticist painter and is considered along with Johan Christian Dahl to be one of Norway's foremost landscape painters. He has been called a mainstay of Norwegian National Romanticism. He is associated with the Düsseldorf school of painting.
Gude's artistic career was not one marked with drastic change and revolution, but was instead a steady progression that slowly reacted to general trends in the artistic world. Gude's early works are of idyllic, sun-drenched Norwegian landscapes which present a romantic, yet still realistic view of his country. Around 1860 Gude began painting seascapes and other coastal subjects. Gude had difficulty with figure drawing initially and so collaborated with Adolph Tidemand in some of his painting, drawing the landscape himself and allowing Tidemand to paint the figures. Later Gude would work specifically on his figures while at Karlsruhe, and so began populating his paintings with them. Gude initially painted primarily with oils in a studio, basing his works on studies he had done earlier in the field. However, as Gude matured as a painter he began to paint en plein air and espoused the merits of doing so to his students. Gude would paint with watercolors later in life as well as gouache in an effort to keep his art constantly fresh and evolving, and although these were never as well received by the public as his oil paintings, his fellow artists greatly admired them.
Gude spent forty-five years as an art professor and so he played an important role in the development of Norwegian art by acting as a mentor to three generations of Norwegian artists.  Young Norwegian artists flocked to wherever Gude was teaching, first at the Academy of Art in Düsseldorf and later at the School of Art in Karlsruhe.  Gude also served as a professor at the Berlin Academy of Art from 1880 to 1901, although he attracted few Norwegians to the Berlin Academy because by this time Berlin had been surpassed in prestige in the eyes of young Norwegian artists by Paris.

Over the course of his lifetime Gude won numerous medals, was inducted as an honorary member into many art academies, and was awarded the Grand Cross of the Order of St. Olav. He was the father of painter Nils Gude and watercolorist and illustrator Agnes Charlotte Guide. His daughter Sigrid married German sculptor Otto Lessing.

name: Peder Balke
english_bio: Painter known for portraying Norwegian landscapes in a romantic and dramatic manner.
norwegian_bio: Maler kjent for å skildre norske landskap på en romantisk og dramatisk måte.
summary: Peder Balke (November 4, 1804 – February 5, 1887) was a Norwegian painter. He is known for portraying the landscape of Norway in a romantic and dramatic manner.

name: Frits Thaulow
english_bio: Impressionist painter best known for naturalistic depictions of landscapes, especially winter scenes.
norwegian_bio: Impresjonistisk maler best kjent for naturalistiske skildringer av landskap, spesielt vinterscener.
awards: Order of Saints Maurice and Lazarus
summary: Frits Thaulow (20 October 1847 – 5 November 1906) was a Norwegian Impressionist painter, best known for his naturalistic depictions of landscape.

name: Nikolai Astrup
english_bio: Modernist painter noted for intense use of color in depictions of Vestlandet landscapes and traditional rural life.
norwegian_bio: Modernistisk maler kjent for intens bruk av farger i skildringer av Vestlandet-landskap og tradisjonelt bygdeliv.
summary: Nikolai Astrup (Norwegian pronunciation: [nɪkʊˈlɑ̀i̯ ˈɑ̀stɾʉp]) (30 August 1880 – 21 January 1928) was a Norwegian modernist painter. Astrup was a distinctive, innovative artist noted principally for his intense use of color depicting the lush landscapes of Vestlandet featuring the traditional way of life in the region.

name: Odd Nerdrum
english_bio: Figurative painter known for anti-modernist stance and self-proclaimed kitsch art, with themes referencing anecdote and narrative, influenced by Rembrandt and Caravaggio.
norwegian_bio: Figurativ maler kjent for anti-modernistisk holdning og selvproklamert kitschkunst, med temaer som refererer til anekdoter og narrative, påvirket av Rembrandt og Caravaggio.

name: Harald Sohlberg
english_bio: Neo-romantic painter famous for mountain scenes like Vinternatt i Rondane.
norwegian_bio: Nyromantisk maler kjent for fjellscener som Vinternatt i Rondane.

notable_works.title: Winter Night in the Mountains. Study
Winter Night in the Mountains. Study

summary: Harald Oskar Sohlberg (29 November 1869 – 19 June 1935) was a Norwegian Neo-romantic painter.

name: Erik Werenskiold
english_bio: Illustrator and Realist painter known for drawings in Norske Folkeeventyr and illustrations for Snorre Sturlasons Heimskringla, as well as portraits of figures like Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson and Henrik Ibsen.
norwegian_bio: Illustratør og realistisk maler kjent for tegninger i Norske Folkeeventyr og illustrasjoner til Snorre Sturlasons Heimskringla, samt portretter av figurer som Bjørnstjerne Bjørnson og Henrik Ibsen.
summary: Erik Theodor Werenskiold (11 February 1855 – 23 November 1938) was a Norwegian painter and illustrator. He is especially known for his drawings for the Asbjørnsen and Moe collection of Norske Folkeeventyr, and his illustrations for the Norwegian edition of the Snorri Sturlason Heimskringla.

name: Adolph Tidemand
english_bio: Genre painter of rural life, central to the Düsseldorf school, known for works like Brudeferd i Hardanger and Haugianerne.
norwegian_bio: Sjangersmaler av bygdeliv, sentral i Düsseldorf-skolen, kjent for verk som Brudeferd i Hardanger og Haugianerne.
summary: Adolph Tidemand (14 August 1814 – 8 August 1876) was a noted Norwegian romantic nationalism painter. Among his best known paintings  are Haugianerne (The Haugeans; 1852) and Brudeferd i Hardanger (The Bridal Procession in Hardanger; 1848), painted in collaboration with Hans Gude.

name: Lars Hertervig
english_bio: Landscape visionary painter who inspired artists like Odd Nerdrum and Kitty Kielland, known for works like Gamle furutrær and Borgøya.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsvisjonær maler som inspirerte kunstnere som Odd Nerdrum og Kitty Kielland, kjent for verk som Gamle furutrær og Borgøya.
summary: Lars Hertervig (16 February 1830 – 6 January 1902) was a Norwegian painter. His semi-fantastical work with motives from the coastal landscape in the traditional district of Ryfylke is regarded as one of the peaks of Norwegian painting.

name: Oda Krohg
english_bio: Bohemian painter and muse who debuted with Ved Christianiafjorden and transitioned from neo-romantic mood paintings to robust portraits.
norwegian_bio: Bohemsk maler og muse som debuterte med Ved Christianiafjorden og gikk over fra nyromantiske stemningsmalerier til robuste portretter.
summary: Oda Krohg (born Othilia Pauline Christine Lasson; 11 June 1860 – 19 October 1935) was a Norwegian painter, and the wife of her teacher and colleague Christian Krohg.

name: Eilif Peterssen
english_bio: Historical and landscape artist known for portraits of Henrik Ibsen and Edvard Grieg, and for designing Norway's coat of arms in 1905.
norwegian_bio: Historisk og landskapsmaler kjent for portretter av Henrik Ibsen og Edvard Grieg, og for å designe Norges riksvåpen i 1905.

notable_works.title: Christian II signing the Death Warrant of Torben Oxe
Christian II signing the Death Warrant of Torben Oxe

summary: Hjalmar Eilif Emanuel Peterssen (4 September 1852 – 29 December 1928) was a Norwegian painter. He is most commonly associated with his landscapes and portraits. He gained early recognition for the history painting Christian II signing the Death Warrant of Torben Oxe and established himself as one of Norway's foremost portrait painters, with portraits of, among others, Henrik Ibsen and Edvard Grieg. He also became known for his landscape paintings, and became part of the artist circle known as the Skagen Painters. He also became known for his design in 1905 of Norway's national coat of arms with the Norwegian lion, which was used by the government and the royal house. The design is still used in the royal coat of arms and the royal flag.

name: Hans Dahl
english_bio: Romantic painter known for landscapes of western Norwegian nature and fjords.
norwegian_bio: Romantisk maler kjent for landskap av vestnorsk natur og fjorder.
summary: Hans Dahl (19 February 1849 – 27 July 1937) was a Norwegian painter.  He was best known for his paintings of Norwegian fjords and surrounding landscapes.

name: Per Krohg
english_bio: Muralist and social Realist who worked as newspaper illustrator, book illustrator, scenographer, sculptor, and portrait painter, including monumental murals.
norwegian_bio: Muralmaler og sosialrealist som arbeidet som avisillustratør, bokillustratør, scenograf, skulptør og portrettmaler, inkludert monumentale veggmalerier.
summary: Per Lasson Krohg (18 June 1889 – 3 March 1965) was a Norwegian visual artist and teacher. He is best known for the mural he created for the United Nations Security Council Chamber, located in the United Nations headquarters in New York City.

name: August Cappelen
english_bio: Nasjonalromantisk painter and early representative of the Düsseldorf school.
norwegian_bio: Nasjonalromantisk maler og tidlig representant for Düsseldorf-skolen.
summary: Hermann August Cappelen (1 May 1827 – 8 March 1852) was a Norwegian painter. Cappelen was best known for his melancholic, dramatic and romantic landscape compositions.

name: Asta Nørregaard
english_bio: Portrait painter known for works like the altarpiece in Gjøvik church and portraits of Kristian Birkeland, King Haakon VII, and young Edvard Munch.
norwegian_bio: Portrettmaler kjent for verk som altertavlen i Gjøvik kirke og portretter av Kristian Birkeland, kong Haakon VII og unge Edvard Munch.
summary: Asta Nørregaard (13 August 1853 – 23 March 1933) was a Norwegian painter who was best known for her portraits.

name: Amaldus Nielsen
english_bio: Naturalist seascape artist who painted studies outdoors, anticipating Impressionism in method.
norwegian_bio: Naturalistisk sjømaler som malte studier utendørs, og forutså impresjonismen i metode.
summary: Amaldus Clarin Nielsen (23 May 1838 – 10 December 1932) was a Norwegian painter.

name: Christian Skredsvig
english_bio: Impressionist painter and writer known for rural scenes.
norwegian_bio: Impresjonistisk maler og forfatter kjent for bygdescener.
summary: Christian Skredsvig (12 March 1854 – 19 January 1924) was a Norwegian painter and writer. He employed an artistic style reflecting naturalism. He is especially well known for his picturesque and lyrical depictions of the landscape.

name: Gunnar Berg
english_bio: Painter known as one of the Lofoten painters.
norwegian_bio: Maler kjent som en av Lofoten-malerne.
summary:
Gunnar Berg may refer to:

Gunnar Berg (composer) (1909–1989), Swiss-born Danish composer
Gunnar Berg (Scouting) (1896–1987), national director of the Boy Scouts of America
Gunnar Berg (painter) (1863–1893), Norwegian painter
Gunnar Berg (politician) (1923–2007), Norwegian politician for the Liberal Party
Gunnar Andreas Berg (born 1954), Norwegian musician and record label owner

name: Halfdan Egedius
english_bio: Young Romantic illustrator and painter who marked himself as an outstanding artist from age 16 until his early death at 21.
norwegian_bio: Ung romantisk illustratør og maler som markerte seg som en fremragende kunstner fra 16-årsalderen til sin tidlige død ved 21.
summary: Halfdan Egedius (May 5, 1877 –  February 2, 1899) was a Norwegian painter and illustrator.

name: Thorolf Holmboe
english_bio: Northern landscape artist, illustrator, and designer influenced by art nouveau and japonism.
norwegian_bio: Nordnorsk landskapsmaler, illustratør og designer påvirket av jugendstil og japanisme.
summary: Thorolf Holmboe (10 May 1866 – 8 March 1935) was a Norwegian painter, illustrator and designer.

name: Jakob Weidemann
english_bio: Abstract modernist considered a pioneer of abstract painting in Norway post-World War II, with Storfuglen letter voted one of the 12 most important Norwegian artworks.
norwegian_bio: Abstrakt modernist betraktet som en pioner for abstrakt maleri i Norge etter andre verdenskrig, med Storfuglen brev stemt som et av de 12 viktigste norske kunstverk.
summary: Jakob Weidemann (14 June 1923 – 19 December 2001) was a Norwegian artist. Jakob Weidemann is regarded as one of Norway's more important artists of post-war Modernism.  Weidemann's work Storfuglen letter (1959) was selected as one of the twelve most important Norwegian artworks by Morgenbladet.

name: Peder Aadnes
english_bio: Folk art painter who chose upper-class motifs, decorating churches, farm interiors, and furniture in rococo style, bridging traditional folk art and new Norwegian painting.
norwegian_bio: Folkeart maler som valgte overklassemotiver, dekorerte kirker, gårdsinteriører og møbler i rokokkostil, og bygde bro mellom tradisjonell folkeart og ny norsk maleri.
summary:
Peder Pedersen Aadnes (10 August 1739 – 20 June 1792) was a Norwegian rural painter.
Aadnes was born in Odnes in Fluberg. Unusually for a rural painter, he chose typical upper-class subjects for his repertoire. He decorated churches, farm interiors, and furnishings throughout eastern Norway in the Rococo style. Aadnes also painted portraits. His style is often referred to as a transitional form in Norwegian painting, from more traditional folk art to the new style represented by Johan Christian Dahl.

Aadnes was a pioneering artist in the tradition of Dutch and German painters. His style paved the way for the later traditional floral decorations and floral paintings known as rosemaling in villages in Norway, and also formed a backdrop for Norwegian Romantic nationalism. Because of Aadnes's role between traditional Dutch and German Rococo, and between the new Norwegian painting on the one hand and traditional floral paintings on the other, he is sometimes referred to as the greatest Norwegian artist of the 1700s.

name: Zacharias Martin Aagaard
english_bio: Landscape painter specializing in marine painting.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler spesialisert i marin maleri.

name: Rolf Aamot
english_bio: Painter, visual artist, photographer, director, and tonal image composer, pioneer in electronic art in Norway.
norwegian_bio: Maler, visuell kunstner, fotograf, regissør og tonal bildekomponist, pioner i elektronisk kunst i Norge.
summary:
Rolf Aamot (28 September 1934 – 26 February 2024) was a Norwegian painter, film director, photographer and tonal-image composer. Since the 1950s, Aamot had been a pioneer within the field of electronic painting, exploring the emerging technology as it combines with the traditional arts of painting, music, film, theatre, and ballet. Aamot studied painting at the Oslo National Academy of the Arts (Norwegian National Academy of Craft and Art Industry and Norwegian National Academy of Fine Arts), and film at Dramatiska Institutet in Stockholm. Aamot is known for his work as a painter, electronic painter, art photographer, graphic artist, film director, tonal-image composer and cultural author.
Much of his work consists of creating electronic tonal images and thus his work contains elements of photography but is hard to pigeon hole. It is frequently a form of performance art with abstract photographic elements. Since 1966, Aamot's works have been displayed in Scandinavia, France (Paris), Berlin (Germany), Brussels (Belgium), Venice (Italy), Moscow (Soviet Union and subsequently Russia), Kraków (Poland), the United States and Japan. His work can be found in several important public collections. Aamot has been represented at several international film and art festivals throughout the world.

name: Johannes Flintoe
english_bio: Danish-born painter of Norwegian ancestry known for landscapes, costume studies, and historical scenes, playing a role in the transition to romantic nationalism.
norwegian_bio: Danskfødt maler av norsk opprinnelse kjent for landskap, kostymestudier og historiske scener, spilte en rolle i overgangen til romantisk nasjonalisme.
summary: Johannes Flintoe (1786/87, Copenhagen - 27 January 1870, Copenhagen) was a Danish-born painter of Norwegian ancestry. He is known for his landscapes, costume studies and historical scenes. His works play a significant role in the transition to romantic nationalism.

name: Rolf Groven
english_bio: Satirical figurative painter known for political satire like Oljeferden i Hardanger, engaged against EU, racism, and religious oppression.
norwegian_bio: Satirisk figurativ maler kjent for politisk satire som Oljeferden i Hardanger, engasjert mot EU, rasisme og religiøs undertrykkelse.
summary: Rolf Dagfinn Groven (11 March 1943 – 26 March 2025) was a Norwegian painter, known for his satirical art painted in figurative style. Groven's paintings are frequently printed works of art in textbooks used in Norwegian schools, as well as history books.

name: Konrad Knudsen
english_bio: Painter and journalist who hosted Leon Trotsky during his asylum in Norway in 1935.
norwegian_bio: Maler og journalist som var vert for Leon Trotsky under hans asyl i Norge i 1935.
summary: Konrad Gustav Knudsen (19 August 1890 - 16 June 1959) was a Norwegian painter, journalist, and parliamentarian. Knudsen is perhaps best known for inviting Leon Trotsky to live at his house when the Norwegian government granted Trotsky political asylum in June 1935.

name: Wilhelm Peters
english_bio: Painter and illustrator associated with the Modern Breakthrough, known for travels and studies in Rome.
norwegian_bio: Maler og illustratør assosiert med det moderne gjennombrudd, kjent for reiser og studier i Roma.
summary:
Wilhelm Karl Hartwich (or Hartwig) Peters (22 April 1815 – 20 April 1883) was a German naturalist and explorer.
He was assistant to the anatomist Johannes Peter Müller and later became curator of the Berlin Zoological Museum. Encouraged by Müller and the explorer Alexander von Humboldt, Peters travelled to Mozambique via Angola in September 1842, exploring the coastal region and the Zambesi River. He returned to Berlin with an enormous collection of natural history specimens, which he then described in Naturwissenschaftliche Reise nach Mossambique... in den Jahren 1842 bis 1848 ausgeführt (1852–1882). The work was comprehensive in its coverage, dealing with mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, river fish, insects and botany. He replaced Martin Lichtenstein as curator of the museum in 1858, and in the same year he was elected a foreign member of the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences. In a few years, he greatly increased the Berlin Museum's herpetological collection to a size comparable to those of Paris and London. Herpetology was Peters' main interest, and he described 122 new genera and 649 species from around the world. Peters also described at least one new fish species, the piranha Serrasalmus irritans, Peters 1877, based on a specimen reported as from San Fernando de Apure, Venezuela.

name: Halvard Storm
english_bio: Etcher of landscapes who illustrated books for Blix forlag.
norwegian_bio: Etsar av landskap som illustrerte bøker for Blix forlag.
summary: Halvard Storm (August 10, 1877 - May 7, 1964) was a 20th-century Norwegian artist.

name: Jacob Gløersen
english_bio: Genre painter among the naturalists in Norway's golden age of painting.
norwegian_bio: Sjangersmaler blant naturalistene i Norges gyldne alder for maleri.
summary: Jacob Gløersen (28 May 1852–21 August 1912) was a Norwegian painter.

name: Gustav Wentzel
english_bio: Realist painter best known for interiors and domestic and rural scenes with accurate observations and detail.
norwegian_bio: Realistisk maler best kjent for interiører og huslige og bygdescener med nøyaktige observasjoner og detaljer.

notable_works.title: Burial of a sailor in the countryside in Norway
Burial of a sailor in the countryside in Norway

summary: Gustav Wentzel (1859–1927) was a Norwegian painter. He was best known for interiors and domestic and rural scenes. His artistic style was associated with Naturalism and noted for accurate observations and attention to detail.

name: Oscar Wergeland
english_bio: Historical painter best known for Eidsvold 1814, which hangs in the Stortingssalen in Oslo.
norwegian_bio: Historisk maler best kjent for Eidsvold 1814, som henger i Stortingssalen i Oslo.
summary: Oscar Arnold Wergeland (12 October 1844 – 20 May 1910)  was a Norwegian painter. He is best known for his historical painting of the Constituent Assembly at Eidsvoll (Riksforsamlingen på Eidsvoll 1814). Two of his paintings are held in the National Gallery of Norway.

name: Carl Sundt-Hansen
english_bio: Genre painter whose works represent a late naturalistically executed national romanticism, mostly folk life depictions and portraits.
norwegian_bio: Sjangersmaler hvis verk representerer en sen naturalistisk utført nasjonalromantikk, mest folkelivsskildringer og portretter.
summary: Carl Fredrik Sundt-Hansen (30 January 1841, Stavanger – 27 August 1907, Stavanger) was a Norwegian-Danish genre painter in the Romantic Nationalist style.

name: Adelsteen Normann
english_bio: Painter with a northern Norwegian profile, known for landscapes of Vestlandet fjords and Nordland coast, described as a late Düsseldorf painter.
norwegian_bio: Maler med nordnorsk profil, kjent for landskap av Vestlandet-fjorder og Nordland-kyst, beskrevet som en sen Düsseldorf-maler.
summary: Eilert Adelsteen Normann (1 May 1848 – 26 December 1918) was a Norwegian painter who worked in Berlin. He was a noted painter of landscapes of Norway. Normann was the artist who invited Edvard Munch to Berlin, where he painted The Scream. Normann's fjord paintings are credited with making the Norwegian fjords a more popular tourist destination.

name: Axel Revold
english_bio: Modernist muralist, painter, illustrator, and professor.
norwegian_bio: Modernistisk muralmaler, maler, illustratør og professor.
summary: Axel Revold (24 December 1887 – 11 April 1962) was a Norwegian painter, illustrator, and art professor at the Norwegian National Academy of Fine Arts for twenty years. He was highly decorated for his merits.

name: Jean Heiberg
english_bio: Post-Impressionist painter and sculptor.
norwegian_bio: Postimpresjonistisk maler og skulptør.
summary: Jean Hjalmar Dahl Heiberg (19 December 1884 – 27 May 1976) was a Norwegian painter, sculptor, designer and art professor.

name: Olav Christopher Jenssen
english_bio: Contemporary abstract artist and former football player.
norwegian_bio: Samtidig abstrakt kunstner og tidligere fotballspiller.
awards: Ridder av 1. klasse av St. Olavs Orden (2015)
summary:
Olav Christopher Jenssen (born 2 April 1954 in Sortland Municipality, Norway) is a Norwegian artist. Jenssen is considered one of the most acclaimed contemporary Norwegian artists, with a significant international career. He has lived and worked in Berlin for years. From 1996 to 2003 he was professor of painting at the Hochschule Fine Arts in Hamburg, and since 2007, he is professor of painting at the Hochschule Fine Arts in Braunschweig. In 1992, he was selected to exhibit at the prestigious exhibition documenta in Kassel, Germany.
He was festival exhibitor in Bergen in 2000, perhaps considered to be the most prestigious solo show in Norway for a Norwegian artist.  In 2015, Jenssen was appointed Knight 1st Class of the Order of St. Olav "for his contribution as an artist".
His series of paintings; "Lack of Memory" (1992) was named one the 12 most important Norwegian artworks, by Morgenbladet.

name: Bjarne Melgaard
english_bio: Conceptual painter known for provocative and controversial works.
norwegian_bio: Konseptuell maler kjent for provoserende og kontroversielle verk.
summary: Bjarne Melgaard (born 9 September 1967) is a Norwegian artist based in New York City. He has been described as "one of Norway's most important artists" and, following the 2014 publicity about his sculpture Chair, "the most famous Norwegian artist since Edvard Munch."

name: Peder Severin Krøyer
english_bio: Danish painter and sculptor, one of the central Skagen Painters.
norwegian_bio: Dansk maler og skulptør, en av de sentrale Skagen-malerne.

notable_works.title: Midsummer Eve Bonfire on Skagen Beach
Summer Evening on Skagen's Southern Beach
Summer Day at Skagen South Beach
A luncheon. The artist, his wife and the writer Otto Benzon
Midsummer Eve Bonfire on Skagen Beach
Summer Evening on Skagen's Southern Beach
Summer Day at Skagen South Beach
A luncheon. The artist, his wife and the writer Otto Benzon

summary: Peder Severin Krøyer (Danish: [ˈpʰe̝ːðɐ ˈse̝vəˌʁiˀn ˈkʰʁʌjˀɐ]; 23 July 1851 – 21 November 1909), also known as P. S. Krøyer, was a Danish painter.

name: Thomas Fearnley
english_bio: Romantic landscape painter and student of J.C. Dahl, contributing to national romanticism in Norwegian art.
norwegian_bio: Romantisk landskapsmaler og elev av J.C. Dahl, bidro til nasjonalromantikk i norsk kunst.

notable_works.title: Old Birch Tree at the Sognefjord
Old Birch Tree at the Sognefjord

summary:
Thomas Fearnley (Norwegian pronunciation: [ˈfæːɳlɪ], 27 December 1802 – 16 January 1842) was a Norwegian romantic painter, a pupil of Johan Christian Dahl and a leading representative of Norwegian romantic nationalism in painting.
His son Thomas Fearnley (1841–1927) founded the Fearnley dynasty of shipping magnates.

name: Knud Baade
english_bio: Romantic painter of seascapes and moonlit scenes, known as the moonlight painter.
norwegian_bio: Romantisk maler av sjølandskap og måneskinnsscener, kjent som måneskinnsmaleren.

notable_works.title: Moonlight on the Coast of Norway
Moonlight on the Coast of Norway

summary: Knud Baade (28 March 1808 – 24 November 1879) was a Norwegian painter, mostly of portraits and landscapes. He was particularly known for his moonlight paintings which are characterized by strong and dramatic contrasts between light and shadow.

name: Joachim Frich
english_bio: Landscape painter of Norwegian nature, student at the Royal Danish Academy of Fine Arts and pupil of J.C. Dahl in Dresden.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler av norsk natur, elev ved Det kongelige danske kunstakademi og elev av J.C. Dahl i Dresden.
summary: Joachim Christian Geelmuyden Gyldenkrantz Frich (24 July 1810 – 29 January 1858) was a Norwegian landscape painter. He was associated with the Düsseldorf school of painting (Düsseldorf-skolen).

name: Morten Müller
english_bio: Landscape painter known for romantic depictions of fjords and pine forests.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler kjent for romantiske skildringer av fjorder og furuskoger.

notable_works.title: View of Ulriksdal from the South
View of Ulriksdal from the South

summary: Morten Müller (13 February 1828 – 10 February 1911)  was a Norwegian landscape painter.

name: Johan Fredrik Eckersberg
english_bio: Religious and landscape painter known for high mountain scenes.
norwegian_bio: Religiøs og landskapsmaler kjent for høye fjellscener.

notable_works.title: Bridal Escort on the Hardanger Fiord
Bridal Escort on the Hardanger Fiord

summary: Johan Fredrik Eckersberg (16 June 1822 – 13 July 1870) was a Norwegian  painter most noted for his landscapes. Eckersberg  was a prominent figure in the transition from Romanticism to Realism in 19th-century Norwegian art, both as an artistic painter and a teacher at his own art school in Oslo.

name: Otto Sinding
english_bio: Historical and genre painter, poet, and theater director in the late romantic era, known as the painter of Lofoten.
norwegian_bio: Historisk og sjangersmaler, poet og teaterdirektør i senromantisk tid, kjent som Lofotens maler.
summary: Otto Ludvig Sinding (20 December 1842 – 22 November 1909) was a Norwegian painter, illustrator, poet and dramatist. Sinding drew on motives from Norwegian nature, folk life and history.

name: Nils Hansteen
english_bio: Marine and landscape painter important in the second half of the 19th century, also created copper engravings and Christmas cards.
norwegian_bio: Marin og landskapsmaler viktig i andre halvdel av 1800-tallet, skapte også kobberstikk og julekort.
summary: Nils Severin Lynge Hansteen (27 April 1855 – 11 October 1912) was a Norwegian painter. He was known principally for his landscape painting as well as his marine art, often featuring ships in a stormy seas.

name: Eyolf Soot
english_bio: Landscape painter of Norwegian coasts.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler av norske kyster.
summary: Eyolf Soot (24 April 1859 – 30 August 1928) was a Norwegian painter.

name: Ludvig Karsten
english_bio: Expressionist and Fauvist painter inspired by Edvard Munch, Henri Matisse, and French painting, known for bohemian lifestyle.
norwegian_bio: Ekspresjonistisk og fauvistisk maler inspirert av Edvard Munch, Henri Matisse og fransk maleri, kjent for bohemsk livsstil.

notable_works.title: The Flight into Egypt. Copy after Bassano
The Flight into Egypt. Copy after Bassano

summary: Ludvig Karsten (8 May 1876 – 19 October 1926) was a Norwegian painter. He was a neo-impressionist influenced by Edvard Munch, Henri Matisse and contemporary French painting. He first participated at the Autumn exhibition in Kristiania in 1901, and had his first separate exhibition in 1904. He is represented at museums in many Scandinavian cities, including several paintings at the National Gallery of Norway. Karsten was known for his bohemian lifestyle and quick temper.

name: Thorvald Erichsen
english_bio: Impressionist landscape painter influenced by Kristian Zahrtmann and French late Impressionism.
norwegian_bio: Impresjonistisk landskapsmaler påvirket av Kristian Zahrtmann og fransk senimpresjonisme.
summary: Thorvald Erichsen (18 July 1868 - 23 December 1939) was a Norwegian Post-Impressionist painter; known primarily for landscapes and still-lifes.

name: Henrik Lund
english_bio: Portrait and landscape painter in Impressionist style.
norwegian_bio: Portrett- og landskapsmaler i impresjonistisk stil.
summary:
Henrik Lund may refer to:

Henrik Lund (painter) (1879–1935), Norwegian painter and graphic artist
Henrik Lund (academic) (born 1960), Danish engineer and professor at Aalborg University

name: Henrik Sørensen
english_bio: Figurative painter and muralist known for romantic fantasy, religious paintings, dark expressionist works, and nature depictions from Telemark.
norwegian_bio: Figurativ maler og muralmaler kjent for romantisk fantasi, religiøse malerier, mørke ekspresjonistiske verk og naturskildringer fra Telemark.
summary: Henrik Sørensen (12 February 1882 – 24 February 1962) was a Norwegian painter.

name: Pola Gauguin
english_bio: Painter, art critic, and pedagog, son of Paul Gauguin.
norwegian_bio: Maler, kunstkritiker og pedagog, sønn av Paul Gauguin.
summary: Pola Gauguin (6 December 1883 – 2 July 1961) was a Danish-Norwegian painter, art critic and biographer.

name: Rolf Nesch
english_bio: German-born painter and printmaker known for graphic works, also in painting and sculpture.
norwegian_bio: Tyskfødt maler og grafiker kjent for grafiske verk, også i maleri og skulptur.
summary: Rolf (Emil Rudolf) Nesch (January 7, 1893 – October 27, 1975) was a German-born Norwegian expressionist artist, especially noted for his printmaking.

name: Olaf Gulbransson
english_bio: Painter and caricaturist known for illustrations and caricatures, working mainly in Germany.
norwegian_bio: Maler og karikaturtegner kjent for illustrasjoner og karikaturer, arbeidet hovedsakelig i Tyskland.
summary: Olaf Leonhard Gulbransson (26 May 1873 – 18 September 1958) was a Norwegian artist, painter and designer. He is probably best known for his caricatures and illustrations.

name: Bjarne Ness
english_bio: Painter of northern Norwegian motifs, influenced by Matisse school and old masters like Michelangelo.
norwegian_bio: Maler av nordnorske motiver, påvirket av Matisse-skolen og gamle mestere som Michelangelo.
summary: Bjarne Ness (17 March 1902 – 13 December 1927) was a Norwegian painter and illustrator.

name: Ludvig Eikaas
english_bio: Abstract painter and graphic artist central in the second half of the 20th century.
norwegian_bio: Abstrakt maler og grafiker sentral i andre halvdel av 1900-tallet.
summary: Ludvig Eikaas (20 December 1920 – 5 September 2010) was a Norwegian painter, graphic artist and sculptor. Eikaas was among the first artists in Norway to work in a purely non-figurative idiom.

name: Kåre Tveter
english_bio: Landscape painter focused on light, characterized as the painter of light, known for shades of white.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler fokusert på lys, karakterisert som lysets maler, kjent for nyanser av hvitt.
summary:
Kåre Tveter (25 January 1922 – 21 March 2012) was a Norwegian painter and illustrator. 
He was born in Sør-Odal Municipality. His breakthrough as artist came in 1965. He is represented at various galleries, including the National Gallery of Norway and the Henie-Onstad Art Centre. He was decorated Knight, First Class of the Order of St. Olav in 1999.

name: Kjell Aukrust
english_bio: Illustrator and painter of whimsical scenes, known for Flåklypa stories and drawings.
norwegian_bio: Illustratør og maler av lunefulle scener, kjent for Flåklypa-historier og tegninger.
awards: Ridder av 1. klasse av St. Olavs Orden (1988)
summary: Kjell Aukrust (19 March 1920 – 24 December 2002) was a Norwegian author, poet, artist and humorist.  Aukrust is principally known for his Flåklypa stories and Flåklypa drawings.

name: Kåre Espolin Johnson
english_bio: Painter and illustrator of northern life, with works collected in Galleri Espolin.
norwegian_bio: Maler og illustratør av nordlig liv, med verk samlet i Galleri Espolin.
summary:
Kaare Espolin Johnson (1907–1994) var en norsk billedkunstner og illustratør.  
Mange av hans arbeider er samlet i Galleri Espolin i Kabelvåg, i Vågan kommune, som ble etablert i 1992. Samlingen utgjorde i 2006 nærmere 170 bilder.

name: Frans Widerberg
english_bio: Figurative painter with dynamic forms, featured on a stamp with Vannrytter.
norwegian_bio: Figurativ maler med dynamiske former, featured på et frimerke med Vannrytter.
awards: Ridder av 1. klasse av St. Olavs Orden
summary:
Frans Widerberg (8 April 1934 – 7 April 2017) was a Norwegian painter and graphic artist.
Widerberg was born in Oslo to Nicolai Magnus Widerberg and Ingrid Christine Blom. He made his exhibition debut in Oslo in 1963. Among his works is the woodcut Hieronymus from 1962 and De usynlige from 1979, both at the National Gallery of Norway. He was an exhibitor at the Bergen International Festival, and represented Norway at the Venice Biennale.
Widerberg died at his home on 7 April 2017 after a short illness, one day before his 83rd birthday.

name: Håkon Bleken
english_bio: Contemporary painter of social themes, represented in major Norwegian museums, illustrator, and church decorator.
norwegian_bio: Samtidig maler av sosiale temaer, representert i store norske museer, illustratør og kirkedekoratør.
awards: Commander of the Order of St. Olav
summary:
Håkon Ingvald Bleken (9 January 1929 – 21 January 2025) was a Norwegian painter and graphic artist.
Bleken is represented in several museums in Norway, including the National Museum in Oslo and art museums in Trondheim and Bergen. He illustrated a number of books, and contributed to decoration of churches and public buildings. He was decorated Commander of the Order of St. Olav.

name: Knut Rose
english_bio: Abstract and figurative painter who served as professor at Statens kunstakademi from 1973.
norwegian_bio: Abstrakt og figurativ maler som tjenestegjorde som professor ved Statens kunstakademi fra 1973.
summary:
Knut Rose (født 18. juli 1936 i Trondheim, død 17. september 2002) var en norsk maler. Han var professor ved Statens kunstakademi fra 1973.
Rose var utdannet ved Kunstskolen i Trondheim (1957–59) under Roar Wold, og på Statens Kunstakademi (1959–61) under Aage Storstein og Reidar Aulie. Han hadde sin debututstilling i Unge Kunstneres Samfund i 1963. Rose var gift to ganger, og hadde en sønn fra første ekteskap.
Rose laget i 1988 en serie på 30 litografi til Henrik Ibsens Gengangere, i den franske forleggeren Edouard Weiss' serie med 5 kunstmapper etter Ibsen. 
Hans arbeider har blitt karakterisert slik :

Rose har sin utpregete karakteristiske uttrykksmåte både maleteknisk, følelsesmessig og i motivområde. Hans spesielle amorfe dels utflytende menneskeliknende skikkelser i sammenstillinger med dyr og andre formelementer i billedflaten gir flertolkelige assosiasjoner. I mange av bildene er det to - tre menneskeskikkelser i varierende størrelse som skaper spenning.Ofte bruker han mørke farver som bakgrunn for sine lysere skikkelser som står i kontrast til disse. Andre ganger benyttes sterke mere lysende farver.Roses bilder blir som en flytende drømmeverden hvor en umiddelbart blir medskapende.

name: Knut Rumohr
english_bio: Abstract painter inspired by nature, known as a nestor in Norwegian graphic art.
norwegian_bio: Abstrakt maler inspirert av naturen, kjent som en nestor i norsk grafikk.
summary: Knut Lindstrøm Rumohr (21 December 1916 – 31 October 2002) was a Norwegian painter and printmaker.

name: Kjartan Slettemark
english_bio: Conceptual painter and performance artist known for controversial works in the 1960s and 1970s.
norwegian_bio: Konseptuell maler og performancekunstner kjent for kontroversielle verk på 1960- og 1970-tallet.
summary: Kjartan Slettemark (6 August 1932, Naustdal, Norway – 13 December 2008, Stockholm, Sweden) was a Norwegian-Swedish artist.

name: Vebjørn Sand
english_bio: Contemporary figurative and landscape painter with public art projects, part of Galleri Sand collective.
norwegian_bio: Samtidig figurativ og landskapsmaler med offentlige kunstprosjekter, del av Galleri Sand-kollektivet.
summary: Vebjørn Sand (born March 11, 1966) is a Norwegian painter and artist. He is known for his paintings as well as his public arts projects, such as the Da Vinci Project, and the Kepler Star monument (Norwegian Peace Star) at Oslo Airport, Gardermoen.

name: Håkon Gullvåg
english_bio: Portrait and church painter known for alienated figures in dystopian landscapes and fantastical scenarios.
norwegian_bio: Portrett- og kirkemaler kjent for fremmedgjorte figurer i dystopiske landskap og fantastiske scenarioer.
summary: Håkon Gullvåg (born 20 February 1959) is a Norwegian painter.

name: Ørnulf Opdahl
english_bio: Landscape painter of western Norway, renewing Norwegian landscape art with coast and fjord motifs.
norwegian_bio: Landskapsmaler av vest-Norge, fornyer norsk landskapskunst med kyst- og fjordmotiver.
summary: Ørnulf Opdahl (born 5 January 1944) is a Norwegian painter and educator. He was born in Ålesund. He is represented in several art collections, including the National Gallery of Norway, Bergen Art Museum and the Astrup Fearnley Museum of Modern Art. He was appointed professor at the Norwegian National Academy of Fine Arts from 1985 to 1992.

name: Kjell Pahr-Iversen
english_bio: Abstract painter represented in Nasjonalgalleriet and other museums.
norwegian_bio: Abstrakt maler representert i Nasjonalgalleriet og andre museer.
awards: Ridder av 1. klasse av St. Olavs Orden (2020)
summary:
Kjell Oddvar Pahr-Iversen  (født  1937) er en norsk maler.
Han fikk sin  utdanning ved Kunst- og håndverkskolen i Bergen og ved Kunstakademiet i København. Pahr-Iversen er representert blant annet i  Nasjonalgalleriet og ved en rekke andre museer. 
Han har hatt mange utsmykningsoppdrag, og er en kjent norsk samtidskunstner.
Pahr-Iversen modellerer bildene sine med lys og skygge. Han bruker farger og penselstrøk på en ekspresjonistisk måte. Han er veldig  opptatt av lys og benytter seg av en maleteknikk som gjør at bildene hans får en spesiell glød og intensitet.  
Pahr-Iversen ble 12. november 2017 utnevnt til æresmedlem av Det russiske kunstakademiet.
I 2020 ble han utnevnt til ridder av 1. klasse av St. Olavs Orden for sin innsats som kunstner.
Han er broren til forfatter og tidligere sjefredaktør Engwall Pahr-Iversen.

name: Lisa Aisato
english_bio: Illustrator and painter of children's books.
norwegian_bio: Illustratør og maler av barnebøker.
summary: Lisa Aisato N'jie Solberg, pen name Lisa Aisato (born 23 July 1981), is a Norwegian visual artist, illustrator and author of picture books.

name: Gerhard Munthe
english_bio: Decorative painter influenced by folk art, also drawer, book and textile artist.
norwegian_bio: Dekorativ maler påvirket av folkeart, også tegner, bok- og tekstilkunstner.
summary: Gerhard Peter Frantz Munthe (19 July 1849 in Elverum, Hedmark – 15 January 1929 in Lysaker, Bærum) was a Norwegian painter and illustrator.

name: Kjell Nupen
english_bio: Contemporary painter and sculptor.
norwegian_bio: Samtidig maler og skulptør.
summary: Kjell Nupen (September 5, 1955 – March 12, 2014) was a Norwegian contemporary artist. He was a painter, sculptor and graphic artist.

name: Pushwagner
english_bio: Pop art painter known for graphic novels like Soft City, exponent of pop art in Norway.
norwegian_bio: Pop art-maler kjent for grafiske romaner som Soft City, eksponent for pop art i Norge.

notable_works.title: A Day in the Life of the Mann Family
A Day in the Life of the Mann Family

summary: Terje Brofos (2 May 1940 – 24 April 2018), better known by stage name Hariton Pushwagner, was a Norwegian Pop artist.

name: Bjørn Ransve
english_bio: Abstract and figurative painter with over 30 solo exhibitions, represented in Norwegian and Swedish galleries.
norwegian_bio: Abstrakt og figurativ maler med over 30 separatutstillinger, representert i norske og svenske gallerier.
summary:
Bjørn Ransve (born 16 December 1944) is a Norwegian painter and graphical artist. He was born in Oslo. He is represented in several art collections, including the National Gallery of Norway, Lillehammer Art Museum and the Norwegian Museum of Contemporary Art.
In 2023 he was knighted as a Commander of the Order of St. Olav. He resides at Nesøya.

name: Arne Ekeland
english_bio: Social realist painter who worked in various art forms including silkscreen, ink wash, watercolor, gouache, and oil painting.
norwegian_bio: Sosialrealistisk maler som arbeidet i ulike kunstformer inkludert silketrykk, blekkvask, akvarell, gouache og oljemaleri.
summary:
Arne Ekeland (14 August 1908 – 28 February 1994) was a Norwegian painter.
He was born in Eidsvoll. Among his works are Ser vi står på trappene from 1939, De siste skudd from 1940, and Kampen from 1943, all located at the National Gallery in Oslo. He is also represented at the Gothenburg Museum of Art. His painting Frihetens søstre is located at Stortinget. He was awarded the Prince Eugen Medal in 1978, and was decorated Knight, First Class of the Order of St. Olav in 1980.

name: Kai Fjell
english_bio: Surrealist-inspired painter, scenographer, and drawer.
norwegian_bio: Surrealistinspirert maler, scenograf og tegner.
summary: Kai Breder Fjell (Norwegian pronunciation: [ˈkɑɪ ˈfjɛl]; March 2, 1907 – January 10, 1989) was a Norwegian painter, printmaker and scenographer.

name: Reidar Aulie
english_bio: Social realist painter with socialist content in 1930s works, part of efforts to make Oslo's buildings more colorful.
norwegian_bio: Sosialrealistisk maler med sosialistisk innhold i 1930-tallets verk, del av innsatsen for å gjøre Oslos bygninger mer fargerike.
summary: Reidar Aulie (13 March 1904 – 23 November 1977) was a Norwegian artist.

name: Arne Kavli
english_bio: Expressionist painter known for light, cheerful colors and carefree summer motifs, associated with Edvard Munch.
norwegian_bio: Ekspresjonistisk maler kjent for lyse, muntre farger og bekymringsløse sommermotiver, assosiert med Edvard Munch.

name: Søren Onsager
english_bio: Impressionist painter inspired by Edvard Munch and French art, characterized as a neo-Impressionist and refined colorist with nudes and landscapes.
norwegian_bio: Impresjonistisk maler inspirert av Edvard Munch og fransk kunst, karakterisert som en nyimpresjonist og raffinert kolorist med nakenbilder og landskap.
summary:
Søren Onsager (6 October 1878 – 28 November 1946) was a Norwegian painter.
Onsager was born at  Holmestrand in Vestfold, Norway. His parents were Martin Onsager (1849–1926) and Laura Dorothea Christensen (1858–1934). His father operated pharmacies in which he first apprenticed. However an Italian trip during 1897–1898 was the turning point in his life. Upon his return to Norway, he trained with Harriet Backer. After a year, she sent him to Kristian Zahrtmann in Copenhagen, where he was for two years. During the period from 1902 to 1910, he went to Paris to study with Christian Krogh at Colarossi Academy. In 1908, he first exhibited at the Salon des Beaux-Arts in Paris. Onsager was appointed professor at the Oslo National Academy of the Arts during the Nazi occupation of Norway from 1940 to 1945. After the war, Onsager was indicted for treason, but he died in prison after a long illness before his case came up.

name: Nils Gude
english_bio: Portrait painter, son of Hans Gude.
norwegian_bio: Portrettmaler, sønn av Hans Gude.
summary: Nils Gude (4 April 1859 in Düsseldorf, Kingdom of Prussia – 24 December 1908 in Christiania) was a Norwegian portrait painter.

name: Bernt Lund
english_bio: Romantic landscape painter, officer, road engineer, and writer known for the poem about Trysil-Knut and contributions to Norge fremstillet i Tegninger.
norwegian_bio: Romantisk landskapsmaler, offiser, veingeniør og forfatter kjent for diktet om Trysil-Knut og bidrag til Norge fremstillet i Tegninger.
summary: Bernt Lund (July 14, 1812 – October 30, 1885) was a 19th-century Norwegian landscape artist, author and military officer.

name: Oluf Wold-Torne
english_bio: Decorative painter influenced by stays in Florence, Berlin, Italy, and Paris.
norwegian_bio: Dekorativ maler påvirket av opphold i Firenze, Berlin, Italia og Paris.
summary: Oluf Wold-Torne (7 November 1867 – 19 March 1919) was a Norwegian painter, illustrator, educator and designer. He was known primarily for landscapes and still-lifes and was influenced by Cézanne.

name: Torleiv Stadskleiv
english_bio: Painter who lived most of his life in Bø i Telemark.
norwegian_bio: Maler som bodde mesteparten av livet sitt i Bø i Telemark.

name: Ida Lorentzen
english_bio: Interior painter known for realistic depictions of empty interiors with color tones and light-shadow effects appealing to emotions, also portraits including Queen Sonja.
norwegian_bio: Interiørmaler kjent for realistiske skildringer av tomme interiører med fargetoner og lys-skygge-effekter som appellerer til følelser, også portretter inkludert dronning Sonja.
summary: Ida Margrethe Lorentzen (born December 11, 1951, in New York City ) is an American born, Norwegian artist known for her paintings of interiors of a melancholic nature.

name: Marianne Aulie
english_bio: Contemporary painter known for colorful works with clowns as main motifs, inspired by neo-expressionism and action painting.
norwegian_bio: Samtidig maler kjent for fargerike verk med klovner som hovedmotiver, inspirert av nyekspresjonisme og actionmaleri.
summary:
Marianne Aulie (born 23 October 1971, in Lørenskog) is a Norwegian painter and former model. She is a Norwegian contemporary artist, primarily known for painting and performance art. Aulie's large, colorful and expressive paintings explore the neo expressionist, action paint and neo pop art movements. Aulie is also known for her controversial performance art and guerilla marketing tactics to draw attention to her work, often employing nudity and dramatic gestures to do so. 
Aulie is often noted for her success as a woman in the male-dominated art scene in Norway. In 2018, she placed 11th in net income in a list of the country's most profiled visual artists, the highest ranking for a woman.
